body_html: It does appear to be consistent with numpy. I find it extremely bug-prone. I think it would be safer to have two operators, like, maybe by default it always does advanced indexing, but if you want the view, then you'd do something specific like indexed_view(). This would then crash out with an exception if the requested view is impossible.
body_text: It does appear to be consistent with numpy. I find it extremely bug-prone. I think it would be safer to have two operators, like, maybe by default it always does advanced indexing, but if you want the view, then you'd do something specific like indexed_view(). This would then crash out with an exception if the requested view is impossible.
body: It does appear to be consistent with numpy. I find it extremely bug-prone. I think it would be safer to have two operators, like, maybe by default it always does advanced indexing, but if you want the view, then you'd do something specific like `indexed_view()`. This would then crash out with an exception if the requested view is impossible.
